tn.ref: Take vengeance on the Midianites for what they did to the Israelites
tn.text: Yahweh was punishing the Midianites for convincing the Israelites to worship idols.

tn.ref: you will die and be gathered to your people
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing. This is a polite way to emphasize that it is time for Moses to die and for his spirit to go to the place where his ancestors are. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: Arm some of your men for war
tn.text: "Give weapons to some of your men"

tn.ref: go against Midian and carry out Yahweh's vengeance on it
tn.text: "go fight a war against the Midianites and punish them for what they did to us"
"1,000 ... 12,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Israel's thousands and thousands of men
tn.text: "Israel's many men"

tn.ref: one thousand were provided from every tribe for war
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "every tribe sent 1,000 men to war" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
All 12 tribes sent men, including the tribe of Levi. They all sent 1,000 men into battle. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba
tn.text: These are names of kings of Midian. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Beor was Balaam's father. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:22:05|22:5]].
"They took the Midianites' possessions as their own"

tn.ref: They burned all their cities where they lived and all their camps
tn.text: "Israel's army burned all the Midianites' cities where the Midianites lived and all the Midianites' camps"
"The army of Israel took"
This refers to the material goods they recovered from killing the Midianite men.
a large area of flat land
These are military leaders who commanded more than 1,000 men but less than 10,000 men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The words "of soldiers" is understood. AT: "of thousands of soldiers ... of hundreds of soldiers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
These are military leaders who commanded more than 100 men but less than 1,000 men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Have you let all the women live?
tn.text: The law was explicit on who would be permitted to live. The army violated the law by allowing all the women and children to live. This was a rebuke to the army leaders. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
This refers to listening and perceiving what the speaker is telling their audience. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
had sexual relations with a man (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
Moses speaks to the commanders of the Israelite army about becoming clean before God.

tn.ref: who have never slept with a man
tn.text: This refers to girls who were virgins. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
Moses is referring to anyone who fought in battle, not just the commanders.
They must become spiritually clean again before entering the camp.

tn.ref: everything made of animal hide and goats' hair, and everything made of wood
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "everything that someone has made of animal hide, goats' hair, or wood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Eleazar teaches the soldiers the customs of becoming ceremonially clean before Yahweh after going to war.

tn.ref: gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, and lead
tn.text: metals that were used during that time period
"that will not burn"
"put it into the fire"
This refers to water that someone has mixed with ashes from a sin offering. See: [[:en:bible:notes:num:19:17|19:17-19]].
These are the customs of becoming ceremonially clean before Yahweh.

tn.ref: Count all the plundered things that were taken
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Count all of the possessions that the soldiers took" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to all the items taken from the people Israel killed or captured in battle.

tn.ref: the leaders of the community's ancestor's clans
tn.text: "the leaders of each clan"
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.
"me" refers to Yahweh.

tn.ref: Then levy a tax to be given to me from the soldiers who went out to battle
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Collect a tax from the soldiers' plunder and give it to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"every 500" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"from the soldiers' half"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which he will present to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues speaking to Moses.

tn.ref: Also from the people of Israel's half
tn.text: "Also from the people of Israel's half of the plunder"
"every 50" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
those who oversee and maintain the tabernacle and sacrifices to Yahweh
This word is used here to mark a break in the main teaching. Here Moses begins listing the amount of plunder and how much went to the soldiers, to the people, and to Yahweh.

tn.ref: seventy-two thousand oxen, sixty-one thousand donkeys, and thirty-two thousand women
tn.text: two thousand oxen, sixty-one thousand donkeys, and thirty-two thousand women** - "72,000 oxen, 61,000 donkeys, and 32,000 women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: women who had never slept with any man
tn.text: This refers to women who are virgins. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
Moses is listing the plunder that goes to the soldiers and the tax that goes to Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: The half that was kept for the soldiers
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The soldiers' part of the sheep" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
six thousand** - 36,000 (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
two** - 72 (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Moses is listing the plunder that goes to the soldiers and the tax that goes to Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
one** - 61 (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
16,000 (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
two** - 32 (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: to be an offering presented to Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to be an offering to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Moses is listing the plunder that goes to the people and the tax that goes to Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
six thousand oxen** - 36,000 oxen (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

"16,000 women". It has been stated earlier that all the males and the married women captives were put to death (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Moses is listing the plunder that goes to the people and the tax that goes to Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The tax on the people's portion was higher than the tax on the soldiers' portion.

These are military leaders who commanded more than 1,000 men but less than 10,000 men. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:num:31:13|31:14]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The words "of soldiers" is understood. AT: "over thousands of soldiers ... over hundreds of soldiers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

These are military leaders who commanded more than 100 men but less than 1,000 men. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:num:31:13|31:14]] (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The commanders refer to themselves as "your servants." This is a polite way to speak to someone with greater authority.
This can be stated in a positive statement. "we know for certain that every man is here" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
The officers of the army continue speaking to Moses.

tn.ref: armlets and bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces
tn.text: These are all types of jewelry that people wore.

tn.ref: to make atonement for ourselves before Yahweh
tn.text: "to thank God for saving our lives"

tn.ref: the gold and all the articles of craftsmanship
tn.text: "all the articles of gold" or "all the golden jewelry"

tn.ref: All the gold of the offering that they gave to Yahweh—the offerings from the commanders of thousands and from the captains of hundreds—weighed
tn.text: "All the gold which the commanders of the army gave to Yahweh weighed"
"sixteen thousand, seven hundred fifty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
A shekel is 11 grams. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bmoney]])

tn.ref: as a reminder of the people of Israel for Yahweh
tn.text: The gold will remind the people that Yahweh gave them victory. It will also remind Yahweh that the people fulfilled his revenge on the Midianites.
